instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message:
This board did have liquid contact. Plenty of corrosion along the hinge edge of the board. 

replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> and repaired a trace between. pin 4 and pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> 

also repaired trace between <RESISTOR>R3896</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C3888</CAPACITOR>

replaced f9700. 

Not sure where to look.

Hoping it isn't an smc issue

probelm happens with/without battery

with without bil

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message:
Check if on SMC by pass still shuts down.....
Also try another ram memory, try one slot at a time...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: Great idea i didn't even think about smc bypass.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: Check Current Sense resistors in <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> area

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: Disconnect keyboard to rule out a flaky power button. Corrosion under SMC also very likely.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: Does the same thing with smc bypass, however after it crashed i unplugged and plugged back in and am presented with an efi password for the first time, Is it possible i have a corrupt efi? The customer did provide the proper password and it does accept it however it still crashes the same.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: and more interestingly, with option held at boot it will crash before the boot menu.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: I said to disconnect keyboard. Reflow SMC and inspect for corroded reistors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b powers up, starts loading os, then cuts power completely.
threads.message: Did test without keyboard connected. Did reflow the smc after removing underfill. Did replace any corroded resistors i could find. Too much time invested into that board, sold customer a replacement board.
